result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Jurgerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Any counseling that the agent recommends.  A stipulation will be filed for jail credit due.  Bond from 15CM347 Columbia County Case is to be applied towards restitution on this case.

Civil judgment entered, if unpaid financials.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 1116 W Wisconsin Apt. B9, Portage, marked   "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."
Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 1-5-17; unpaid supervision fees of $300

Cases called: 15CM254 & 14CM568, Defendant Brandon J Jurgerson in court, in custody with attorney J. Steven House.  ADA Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties received Revocation paperwork. Sentencing statement by Atty. House. Court addressed defendant, sentenced defendant in 14CM568 to 30 days jail.  In 15CM254, to 4 months jail, consecutive to 14CM568. Jail credit in 14CM568 - 23 days,  in 15CM254 - 98 days jail credit for time served. Civil judgment if applicable.
for sentence after revocation on 1-5-17 @ 3:30 p.m.
filed by Probation Agent Brian Reynolds
filed by Atty House
Restitution Stipulation in the probation amount of $2131.63 and a total of $2344.79.
filed by Atty House

Defendant Brandon J Jurgerson in court with attorney J. Steven House.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 14CM568, 15CM254, 15CM334, and 15CM347.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled guilty to 14CM568 and guilty to 15CM254.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  15CM334 dismissed.  15CM347 dismissed but read in.  In 14CM568 and 15CM254 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include:  $443.00 costs both cases.  Any counseling that the agent recommends.  Restitution in 15CM254 $2131.63 and surcharge.  A stipulation will be filed for jail credit due.  Cash bond on 15CM334 will be returned to poster.  15CM347 bond to be applied towards restitution.
Return date at 08-20-2015 02:45 pm

Defendant, Brandon J Jurgerson, appeared with Attorney Steven House. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived. State requested cash bond. $500 recog. bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
